page.title: 16ECOLOGY- COMMON MOOR PLANTS
page.content: On{Ilkley Moor}the most common plants are{crowberry, bracken, bilberry, matt {grass and heather.}There are also{ {rushes, cotton grass, wavy hair grass {and purple moor grass. Crowberry}is the most common, but it prefers the less exposed areas. It is a short and creeping plant and it likes to wind about leaves.{Heather}is found higher up on the moor. It is a creeping plant and produces pink, bell-shaped flowers.{Bilberry}has round, broad leaves and looses them in winter, unlike crowberry.{Bracken}is common as the sheep do not eat it, because it has a hard stout stem and the roots are underneath the ground.{Matt grass} grows in a clump and it is a coarse, stout grass.
